67910.description:
Travel or mini FiTs is a smaller version of FiTs. The differences are


There are only 52 cardboard vs 64 plastic game tiles
There are only 13 vs 16 building cards
There are only 4 vs 8 game boards printed on both sides
The 2nd board allows players to score bonus points if three of the same symbols are exposed.
The height of the board is 10 vs 12 rows.
There are no ramps or plastic covers just a place to mount the game boards.
The box is so much smaller.


Other than those differences the game-play is the same as FiTs. Each player has a board on which they place different polyominoes, with three, four, or five squares. Cards are drawn from a pile to tell the players which piece to take. But as every player has a different start tile to place first, the players will need different tactics to maximise their points. The pieces may be rotated and reversed before they slide down the board. Scoring is based on quantity and configuration of squares left uncovered.

Reimplements:


FITS
67910.name: Mini FITS

67911.name: Der Zankapfel
67911.description:
Der Znankapfel is a tile placement game, in which players boult trees with hexagonal limb cards.
During the phases spring, summer, and autumn, depending on a dice roll, you can place lims (straight, bend, brachn), apples or special tiles like beehives. The player who harvests the most apples (and gets a bonus form specials like the hive) wins the game.

67912.description:
Manimals is a beautiful animal game that is also well-suited for learning in the classroom or for use in homes. Through the game, players learn the attributes of animals.
Who knows the animals best?

All animal cards are placed face up on the table. One card is flipped. The backside shows a search criterion like, has finger, can swim or has feathers. Players than simultaneously collect animals they believe to fit this criteria. As soon as nobody wants to pick another animal, the backsides of the cards are examined, to check if the choice was correct. The player with the most correct animals scores two points, the second one scores one.

Includes rules for ages 4 and up, as well.

The focus of this edition is: Animals from Australia and New Zealand.
67912.name: Manimals: Australien & Neuseeland 1

67913.name: SLURPS
67913.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

About SLURPS

SLURPS is an acronym for Simplest Little Unitarian Role Playing System. Each Player takes on two different roles, that of Divinity and that Divinity's Supplicant. In the unitariverse of SLURPS, every Supplicant carries his own interpretation of the Divine Being. And according to the rules, each of these interpretations is true.

The material required for a game of Slurps is a pair of ten-sided dice, of different colors, and writing supplies. This is always rolled as a percentile, meaning one die is always the tens digit, and the other is always the ones digit. A roll of 00 is read as one-hundred.

Supreme Being

Where most other games have one gamemaster, SLURPS gives each Player a chance to be Supreme Being. Every Player takes a turn at being Supreme Being at least once. When you are Supreme Being you create the locations, situations and any non-Supplicant characters, as well as control your Supplicant. You basically take the role of a gamemaster who also plays a character. Try to stay consistent with what the other Players have created before you as Supreme Being.

67914.name: Sitcom
67914.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Roleplaying in T.V. Hell


Dice
Everyone Player gets five dice. The GM begins with only one (and gets more as the game is played). It doesn't matter how many sides, so long as everyone's dice have the same number of sides. Remember that the more sides, the longer the game will tend to last. Six- or ten-sided dice are recommended.



Your Character
You get to invent a character. Someone who whines, gets in trouble, is afraid to admit he's wrong: A typical sitcom character. If you fancy yourself a major part of the Sitcom, your character's first name is the same as your own.



Annoy
Pick something about your character that annoys the audience. This is called your Annoy. For example, Ray Romano would have an Annoy of Whine, alien Dick's Annoy is Pretentious Overacting, ALF's annoy is Being ALF.



Putting the Situational in...
The GM deviously sets up some bizarre and stupid situation that can conceivably be solved in thirty minutes. This should allow for the Sitcom format: Problem introduced, problem seems unsolvable, stupid fix three minutes before credits roll, everyone laughs.

67915.name: The Jon Morris Sketchbük Roleplaying Game
rpg: The Jon Morris Sketchbük Roleplaying Game
67915.description:
From the game's introduction:

Welcüm to the Sketchbük

Jon Morris is a simple man, devoting his time to a loving wife, his chicken coop and the most extensive online sketchbook ever conceived. This sketchbook is so huge, in fact, that I decided it would make a great backdrop for a game. But not any game. Friends, welcome to the Jon Morris Sketchbük Roleplaying Game!

In his own words, "Man, if there's one career out there that seems like a fun-filled and exciting adventure filled with amazing experiences and colorful people, I think that career must be Pokemon Wrangler."

Hmm... I'd better let the game speak for itself.

Gettin' Ready: what yoü need

To play the Jon Morris Sketchbük Roleplaying Game you need:


Some ten-sided dice, preferably all alike.
A ten-sided die that looks different from the rest; an outcast; a loner. This is the Special Die.
An Internet connection and, incidentally, a computer.
A printer and, incidentally, some printer paper.



User Summary:

Randomly selected pieces of art from the pages of Jon Morris' extensive sketchbook to form the basis for characters, in this chaotic and loosely-defined role-playing game.

67916.name: Beyond the Beyond
67916.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

What to do when all has been done?

This is a tiny, folded storytelling game. Beyond the Beyond is set in the most distant imaginable future, where life takes on an infinite variety of form and all things are possible. The story's protagonist faces many foes and challenges, but none more deadly than those who were once considered friends.

Print it out double-sided. Fold in half, then in half, then in half, keeping the game's title visible after each fold. Heck, you can even make copies and hand them out at your local gaming store! The whole thing is covered by a Creative Commons license, so as long as you don't sell it or remove the author's name, you can do whatever you want with it.

67917.description:
Colonialism is a game of 19th Century imperialistic struggle. In this game, each player assumes the role of a nondescript colonial power. Players proceed to struggle for influence in the unindustrialized regions of the world, and the subsequent resources such influence entails.

Each turn is divided into action phases and colonization phases. During action phases, players use cards to secretly bid influence in the six regions of the game board. During colonization phases, all cards in play are revealed, the placement of influence is resolved, and conflict occurs.

Whenever all native influence is eliminated from a region, that region's resources are collected. The amount of resources collected by each player depends on each players' influence in the region. At the end of the game, the player who collects the most resources wins.
67917.name: Colonialism
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 15 – Arkwright
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
Podblast: Colonialism

67919.description:
Chinese-themed card game created by Qian Qi Animation.

The card game uses the theme of the Chinese Movie The Message.

3 Kinds of Cards
Identity: x9
Characters: x18
Function: x81

Its rules are similar to Shadow Hunter combined with Coach Ride To Devil's Castle.

Initially, each player randomly select one of the three identities - Underground, Army, Passby. In addition, each player has one character out of 18 difference one to get difference special character ability.

All function cards divided into three information - Red, Blue or Black (false information). Besides, all function cards can be used for its special function.

During each round, each player draws two function cards. Then, the player transmit one of his function cards to other player as an information. Others player try to collect his requested information while avoid any False information (black). Apart from acting as an information card, function cards can be used for their special function to interrupt information, burnt away false information etc. Any player has received three black information will be dead.

Underground will wins if he collects three Red information cards while Army wins if he collects three Blue information. Passby needs to achieve their special mission based on his characters in order to win.
boardgameversion: Mainland China Simplified Chinese First edition
67919.name: The Message

67920.name: You May Fire When Ready Gridley! Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Naval Wargames 1880 To 1905
67920.description:
Fire When Ready covers actions with pre-dreadnoughts. They come with a set of rules for creating your game statistics for your vessels using published sources such as "Jane’s" or "Conway’s".

The rules features an choice of game systems. The "Duel" Game is intended for use with a small number of ships and each ship has a captain and crew generated individually. The "Battle" system is for large battles such as Tsushima and ships operate in formations, each of which has a Commander and ships' crew ratings are generated for a formation.

There are alternative gunnery systems offering simultaneous effects (which can be used with the "Duel" Game) or sequential effects based on initiative, in which shooting follows in order of initiative (highest scores shoot first) and where damage is applied immediately (this can be used in either game system).

The gunnery rules include the effects of "crossing the T" and other features. It is now possible to achieve significant amounts of damage and multiple special hits.

There are 10 scenarios and ready calculated ship data is provided so you can sit down and play any of them.

(Publishers Description)

67921.name: Fungeon
67921.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

About Fungeon

Fungeon is roleplaying the ancient art of dungeon crawling, only without a gamemaster. During play, each Player creates Traps, Monsters and Treasure for your adventurous Fungeoneers to escape, fight and discover.

Materials

To play Fungeon, you will need tons of dice, all of which must have the same number of sides. Each Player needs one die which is distinguishable from her others, most likely one of a different color. This is called the Thwack-O Die and is discussed in the Narration section.

Fungeon also requires you to do a lot of scribbling, so everyone needs tons of scratch paper. If you are going to map out your adventures, graph paper is recommended.

67922.name: Divine Right (2002)
67922.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

What would you sacrifice to save another?

Divine Right began as a game about exorcism, where the Characters saved peoples' souls at the cost of their own well-being. As design continued it became clear that my notes explored the Premise given above, rather than push a game of exorcism. A modern setting with slight paranormal activity is the closest thing to a default setting, but I kept in mind possibilities ranging from Mike Mignola's Hellboy comic to stories you might hear on the evening news.

This game allows a large amount of freedom for both Players and the GM. Before play, the group should sit down and discuss what level of controls the Players and GM are comfortable with. At one extreme, the Players may only narrate within strict specifics of their roll results. At the other, a GM may not even be necessary. In any case, the rules as written are how the game is meant to be played. If your group alters the rules it is either no longer Divine Right, or an improvement to the game. In either case, I encourage you to let me know!

67923.name: Zogaj
67923.description:
This game is played in two phases. In the first phase all players memorize pairs of tiles with different icons (or triplets or even bigger groups for extra complexity). The pairs are then flipped over and mixed. The example in the rulebook is for instance the pair: tea pot + couch
In the second phase the players take turns flipping two tiles - if one of the pairs were flipped the player keeps it and flips another pair (flip triplets when playing the more difficult variant). The player with most pairs when all tiles are taken wins the game.

beginner variant 10-12 pairs, normal 20 pairs and expert 30 pairs.


From zogaj.se/zogaj-shopen

The Game that teaches you how to use your hidden memory powers while having fun! You will be surprised over how easy it is and how powerful your brain is when used correctly. This game teaches you how to think.

The Game is suitable for all ages. It is perfect as a family-game but also for adults who wants to see how others think. The game is also a powerful learning tool for the person who wants to show grown-ups as well as children how Active Memory techniques works and how one can start to develop a super-memory.

67924.name: White Dwarf (Issue 131 - Nov 1990)
rpgissuearticle: 'Eavy Metal - Fraser Gray, Eldar and Bretonnians
'Eavy Metal - Paul Robins, New Releases and Bretonnian Diorama
Modelling Workshop: Warhammer Fantasy Town House
Warhammer Fantasy Battle Questions and Answers

Mighty Empires: Wizards Towers by Rick Priestley
Necromunda Gangs by Bryan Ansell, Rick Priestley and Nigel Stillman

67925.name: Uchiiri Tyuushingura
67925.description:
This game covers one of the most important Samurai-era episode "Chūshingura". Chūshingura happened December 14th, 1702.
One year before the incident, Asano-takumi, the lord of Akou-han was ordered to harakiri by Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi without detailed judgement due to his outrageous action in Edo-castle.
The 47 warriors of Akou-han had strong will to revenge this judgement and had waited for one year to do the final action.
In falling snow, the 47 warriors assaulted their target Kira's house and did their wish without seriouse damege on their side.
But, Shogun Tokugawa Tsunayoshi again decided to order them harakiri.
Because of their strong will and bushido-spirits, this fact became very popular as "Chūshingura". Even in recent period, this is very popular on TV drama series again and again.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chūshingura

This game covers this episode by small wargame.
8 page rulebook
80 counters
1 map
2 dice

67926.name: Scroll of Exalts
67926.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Chosen of the Incarnae, the Dragons, the Neverborn, the Yozis and the Great Maker all strive to chart the course of Creation. In their attempts, these Exalted heroes often come into conflict or alliance. Within are to be found examples of all seven sorts of Exalt, ranging from the ancient Sidereal Chejop Kejak to the young Dragon-Blood Cathak Meladus and all ages (and power levels) in between. Some aim to destroy the world, while others strive to save it, but regardless of motive, the mover and shakers and the up and comers alike are bound to come into contact with your characters. Whether as friend or foe is up to you to determine.

A character sourcebook for Exalted, Second Edition, featuring:

- Write-ups for of the game’s most renowned Exalts, many of whom have never been statted.
- More than 70 ready-made allies and antagonists for players and Storytellers alike.
- Unique Charms and items.

67927.name: Umbrage Saga: The Wicked Cauldron
67927.description:
From the Back of the Box:

For a thousand years the horned god ruled from his throne in the great towers of Aufstrag. Shaped in mockery of the Great Tree, Aufstrag lorded over the kingdoms of man, elf and dwarf and its master, Unklar, ruled with his iron mace. But time swept him away and into the Void, and upon the ruins of his dark memory new kingdoms have risen, a new world born. An age of heroes is begun, where adventuring crusaders ride forth into the wilderness to reclaim it through the iron in their veins, and the magic they too control.

But memories run deep and the stain of Unklar’s reign is not so easily rooted out. His minions haunt the dark places of the world. They occupy forgotten temples, ruined dungeons, castles on the borderlands; from these bastions they plot the return of their horned master, or at the very least, the terror of men. Here evil resides, and thrives; treasures abound, hidden magic lies unused and forgotten.

There is perhaps no greater bastion for the refugees of Aufstrag than the lands south of that fated tower. The Blacktooth Ridge dominates the country, jutting out from the southern foothills like a finger pointing to Aufstrag. Beneath it flows the slow moving, dark Hruesan River and beyond those banks are the Lands of the Barren Wood and west of it all the Blighted Screed. These lands rest upon the Northern Marches of the Kingdom of New Aenochia, and the few towns that are here, Botkinburg and Ludensheim, lie on the very edge of civilization. These lands are a Wicked Cauldron of desperate evil.

Here adventure abounds, for the Empress has called a Crusade to root out all the evil that hounds her northern domains. Wealth and bounty are promised, and land and title for those so interested. In these twisted woods and in the Shadow of the Great Tree begins the Umbrage Saga.

Adventure to the Wicked Cauldron, begin play at 1st level and run the gauntlet of adventures from the following adventures: A0 Rising Knight, A1 Assault on Blacktooth Ridge, A2 Slag Heap, A3 Wicked Cauldron, A4 Usurpers of the Fell Axe and the A5 The Shattered Horn - Perfect Bound in one Book" - This box set also includes an adventure previously published only in PDF, some new encounters and a more concise history of the great horn and the region.

All you need to start a wild adventure of C&C fun lies in the adventures contained here, in the Umbrage Saga.

67928.description:
Puzzle Strike: Bag of Chips is all that and a bag of chips!

Puzzle Strike is a card game played with cardboard chips instead of cards that simulates a puzzle video game called puzzle fighter that, in-turn, simulates the fighting game street fighter that is emulated in puzzle fighter

If you don’t understand any of that, that’s ok! Puzzle Strike is a complete game in a box that has the fun of a customizable card game without the marketing scheme of selling you parts of the game in random packs. You build your deck *as* you play the game. Every game is different because the bank starts with a different set of chips each game. Also, there are 10 characters to choose from, each with different gameplay. Between all that, there are over 411 MILLION starting conditions in a 4-player game.

A built-in comeback mechanic means that when you're on the edge of losing, you're also able to do even more combos than usual.

Shuffling cards takes too long and is boring, so in Puzzle Strike you just put your cardboard tokens in a bag and shake them up to shuffle! Plus, it’s pretty ballin’ to play a game with chips. Play it on your yacht, impress potential mates, etc.

Though the game is fun even if you're terrible at it, it's also balanced for high level play by veteran asymmetric game balancer David Sirlin (Street Fighter HD Remix, Puzzle Fighter HD Remix, Kongai, Yomi, and Flash Duel.)

Puzzle Strike contains:

Almost 350 cardboard chips
4 cloth bags
8-page full color rulebook
Colorful box with inside designed to separate the chips by type, for storage




Online play: http://www.fantasystrike.com

Re-implemented by:


Puzzle Strike (Third Edition)
67928.name: Puzzle Strike
boardgamepodcastepisode: #30: Design Lessons & Sirlin Games. With David Sirlin
28 Games Later: Puzzle Strike Upgrade!
Dukes of Dice - Ep. 40 - When Colts Cry
Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 02 - Zombie Strike
House Rules 44: Interview with David Sirlin Part I
House Rules 45: Interview with David Sirlin Part II
Session Impressions: Puzzle Strike
The Good, The Board, and the Game That’s Better Than You Say It Is: Episode 29 Underrated Games
The Good, The Board, and The Ugly Episode 6: “Design is not just what it looks like and feels like, design is how it works” -Steve Jobs

67929.name: Cult
67929.description:
Cult is a card-based strategy game about fanciful religious cults. You start with a single god with no worshippers, and during the game, you develop a cult of followers for your god and build a temple to your god. You’ll be in competition with other cults, and you may eventually add other gods and cults to your pantheon. Your goal in the game is to attract more followers (and stronger followers) to your cult and to build complete temples to your gods.

You'll also be able to take your pesky competitor cults down a notch or two with special cards such as Heresy, Purge, Iconoclasm, and many others.

Sometime during the game, there will be a prophecy. When the prophecy is fulfilled, it's the End of Days, and whoever is ahead wins!

The game is family friendly and easy to learn. It takes about 45-60 minutes to play depending on how fast you are.

67931.name: Abeo
67931.description:
From the Back Cover:

The world you think you know is a lie. There are beautiful, dangerous things that feed on your frustration, your fear, your lust. Hiding out in the open, once upon a time, you knew their names; you've just forgotten about them. Only crazy people believe in these things, but you've seen their world before; on the other side of a red haze of rage, in the shadows under your bed.

And now you're becoming one of them.

Welcome to Abeo. Set in a modern world, Abeo blurs the line between the hunter and the hunted as characters face not only the creatures of the night, but their own fears and desires given form. Will they take the next mad step along the path to becoming a monster?


Step into the world on the other side of sanity, meeting creatures out of your darkest nightmares and dearest dreams.
Grasp and twist your mind with over a hundred Pathos powers to choose from, creating change in the world by driving yourself further into delirium. Unbound by the laws of the sane world, soar through city skies on wings of righteous fury or discover the innermost secrets of those around you.
Warp the laws of cause and effect with Ethos, breaking the natural order by combining your Passion and your intellect to walk through mirrors, see through the eyes of another or bind others to do your will.
Play subtler, easier tricks with Logos, directing your will along the lines of sympathy and correspondences to get your way.
As you slip further from reason, develop new and greater Pathos, but discover your Consequences: the prices of Passion. How will your react the first time you can't enter a home uninvited? What will you do when you find out you're becoming something more?

67932.description: Face to Face is an abstract cubist strategy game. Players place tiles representing either an eye, nose, or mouth in the right place at the right time in order to win the game. In the process the cubist inspired games pieces create a unique cubist composition.
67932.name: Face to Face: A Cubist Strategy Game

67933.name: Perfidious Albion: Naval Wargame Rules For The Pre-Dreadnought Era
67933.description:
The game system uses a broadside ship plan to record both the ship game details and the damage caused by shooting. Guns, turrets, conning tower, propulsion, steering gear, magazines and quick firers are all shown, and the damage system records hits and resulting damage. Also included are ship’s crew skills, differences in technology, armour penetration and torpedoes, weather, etc. The rules also allow for torpedo resolution and the use of mines.

The Dockyard Manual is part of the rules, enabling the player to design his own ships for the game, either from historical sources or his imagination. Technological variety is allowed for, so that ships can range from early ironclads to modern (for 1910) warships. The booklet also includes some sample ships built using the design system.

The links include downloads for War in the Air, a Campaign system and Victorian Fantasy Scenarios.

67934.name: Tsushima: Naval Wargame Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Actions
67934.description:
These rules are quick and simple to play providing a very fast and bloody game in the period 1880 to 1906. The scale is 1 nautical mile to 10cm. The rules incorporate weather, spotting, minefields and allow for both written orders or sequential movement.

The gunnery system takes account of the ranges, penetration and damage by specifying the dice that are rolled to attack in a given situation. Torpedo, Mine and Ramming attacks are resolved using similar mechanisms, so there is a consistent feel throughout the combat system.

In line with the style and intention of the rules, armour has been standardised for each class of vessel (of which there are ten covered). Guns have been grouped into 9 classes following the same philosophy.

There is a fleet list covering the significant vessels of 10 nations in this period with 130 vessels. A simple conversion system allows you to quickly put together the game data you need to fight a battle.

Counters are provided to enable you to sit down and play both an introductory scenario and Tsushima-style encounter between Russian and Japanese fleets

(Publishers Description)

67935.name: Fighting Fleets
boardgameexpansion: Perfidious Albion: Naval Wargame Rules For The Pre-Dreadnought Era
You May Fire When Ready Gridley! Rules For Pre-Dreadnought Naval Wargames 1880 To 1905
67935.description:
This booklet provides Ship Grids for Perfidious Albion and Combat data for Fire When Ready rules. There are about 200 classes of ship of all sizes provided from Austria-Hungary, China, France, Germany, Great Britain, Greece, Italy, Japan, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Turkey and United States, as well as some generic cargo ships.

For Perfidious Albion the 10 x 6 Ship Grids can be photocopied or transferred to blank ship cards as you wish. All the data you need to play the game is provided including gunnery modifiers and torpedo sizes. The points value for each ship has been calculated for a standard crew.

For Fire When Ready the game data has been calculated for the ships in the booklet and shows the gunnery data including gun type and penetration required for the game. The armour protection for ships has been assessed and is shown for all the locations needed for the game.

Note that this product is intended for use with Fire When Ready, or Perfidious Albion, and a copy of either of these rules is required.

(Publishers Description)

67936.name: Chick N Derby
67936.description: Rev up Your engines for Chick N Derby, a colorful new family board game where chickens don crash helmets and get behind the wheel in an attempt to be the first to cross the finish line with all of their five Letters lined up to spell D-E-R-B-Y. - Back of Box

67938.name: Forge of War
67938.description:
Forge of War is a free set of tabletop miniature rules for depicting small unit, i.e. squad level, science fiction combat which also includes rules for AFVs and artillery.

Notionally for 28mm scale figures (although it would be equally suitable for other scales such as 15mm) it was originally produced to offer a viable alternative to more complex commercially available rule sets.

With variable unit activation; and with as much emphasis on command, control and morale as there is on the hardware, Forge of War offers a different, yet easily accessible, alternative to more traditional rule sets.

67939.name: Different Worlds (Issue 22 - Jul 1982)
67939.description:
Different Worlds, Issue 22
The Magazine of Game Role-Playing
Cover art by Lisa A Free

Special RuneQuest Issue!

67940.name: Panorama
boardgamepublisher: The Cavalcade of Games Publishing Company
67940.description: This game is a "War-Peace" strategy game. Each player starts the game with a unique "Sealed Orders" sheet which assigns that player a specific color of units, and a list of 4-6 "Peaceful" objectives or 4-6 "War / Agressor" objectives. Each player selects a secret objective from their list. Players then take turns placing their units, trying to capture opponents units or to reach their objective. When a player reaches their objective the game ends and all players add up their victory points to determine the winner.

67941.name: Go-Kart Rally Sight-Words Game: Grade 2
67941.description:
Publisher description:

"A fun way to learn sight-words, build vocabulary, and increase reading fluency.

As students race around the game board, they get hands-on practice using sight-words in context! The game is super-easy to play—students just move around the board, landing on spaces printed with 40 grade-appropriate sight-words. Each time they land on one, students try to use it in a sentence on their game cards. The first one to complete all 8 sentences wins!"

Game components:
Game board
10 write and wipe cards
4 write and wipe markers
4 Game pawns
1 six-sided die

67944.name: Małe zoo
67944.description:
Every child loves to visit the zoo. Admire the magnificent animals, exotic specimens, endangered species. Now all these things can happen on the game board. Each player is the owner of the zoo, he must make to the zoo was full of animals.Be careful with the amount of space at the zoo since we have limited. During the game we decide whether it is better to have large animals such as elephant or a giraffe or more animals, but smaller. Pride of every zoo are rare animals (Panda bear, or Chameleon).
When the zoo will be full of animals, it's time to exchange specimens with other players, and visit our zoo visitors in giving us the victory points. The player who collects the first set of their number to be the winner.

67945.name: Świat Dinozaurów
67945.description: In this game, the player operates and develops its flock of ancient reptiles, must ensure access to water holes. Dinosaurs should be deployed on the board so as to form a herd, the young dinosaurs hatch from eggs and adults occupy more land for your cluster. Unfortunately, the ancient earth was filled with threats, most are predatory Tyrannosaurus! Once the board is moving so terrifying reptile hunts for smaller vulnerable individuals, you have to keep meeting with him. Your herd may dissipate after the attack, Tyrannosaurus, and your effort to build the herd will go for naught. Win the game the player who takes the largest number of holes and bring together the largest herd.

67946.description:
Ascend is a Decktet climbing game for 3 to 4 players.

You and your opponents try to be the first duck to reach the peak. During the ascent you will be set back by bombs falling from the sky. Therefore, it takes quite some personality to persist the ascent in order to be able to crown oneself as King of the Quackers and flush the opponents straight back to the swampy pond they came from.

The game is played over multiple hands. Every hand you get dealt some cards. After each hand, you score points according to how quickly you got rid of your cards. Your points accumulate from hand to hand and once someone collects enough points he or she is declared the winner of the game.
67946.name: Ascend

67947.description:
A trick-taking Decktet game for 3 to 5 players with a lot of trumps.

Double Knot is the favourite trick-taking game among pandas. It's a common habit to end a dispute with a game of Double Knot in order to decide who gets to sleep in the best bed. Unfortunately, in case of a tie, play is continued. This explains the amount of pandas.

The game is named after the two highest cards in the game, the Ace of Knots and the Crown of Knots.

In Double Knot every player bids a number of tricks. The object of the game is to win exactly the number of tricks bid and at the same time let other people fail to do the same.

In a hand of Double Knot, each of the Decktet cards is treated as belonging only to the top suit. The bottom suits of the first card played to a trick determines which cards can be used as trumps in that trick.

The rules of the game can be found at the Decktet wiki.
67947.name: Double Knot

videogamebg: Mahjongg Dimensions Deluxe: Tiles in Time
67948.name: Mahjong Solitaire
67948.description:
It is a solitaire matching game that uses a set of Mahjong tiles. The 144 tiles are arranged in a four-layer pattern with their faces upwards. A tile is open if it can be moved either left or right without disturbing other tiles. The goal is to match open pairs of identical tiles and remove them from the board, exposing the tiles under them for play.

It was originally designed for playing on computers.

67949.name: Rusalka
67949.description:
You are a pesent looking for herbs in forests. You meet mythology beeings from Slavic mythology like Rusalka and Lešij.
It is a small game that was published inside a book about Slavic mythology. Your goal is to colect the most herbs and to be the first one to talk in you village that you saw Rusalka, fairy, Lešij... You can enchanted other players with help of mythology beings or still other players herbs and there is a moment when you have to be first to say Ir to defend your self from snake bite!...

67950.description:
a dice game, try to get your bear over the pond jumping from log to log, get the honey and get back without getting your honey stolen by another bear.

Hmmm..., lecker, schlecker! Da läuft unseren Bären ganz schön das Wasser im Mund zusammen. Die Bienen auf der anderen Seite des Sees haben fleißig Honig gesammelt. Jetzt heißt es für die Bären nichts wie hin. Dabei wird von Baumstamm zu Baumstamm gehüpft. Die sind wackelig und das Wegschnappen und Rauswerfen ist auch erlaubt. Dies bringt Spßa - aber Vorsicht - auch neue Verfolger! Wer sich den meisten Honig holt, wird bärenstarker Gewinner. Spielschachtelformat: 37,5 x 27,5 x 3,5 cm

Publisher Blurb
67950.name: Honigklau

67951.name: De Boer Sjopspel
67951.description:
De Boer Sjopspel is a game where players try to obtain all products listed on a shopping list. They do so by rolling a die to move on the board, trying to get to the items they need. The first person to get all the items and return to the cash register is the winner.

The pawns are in the shape of shopping cards, made from plastic.
The items come in the form of thick cardboard pieces which will be randomly placed on the board. Each card has a picture of the product printed on it. (User summary)

67952.name: Monster Math Add and Subtract
67952.description: Take part in an island adventure that is both fun and challenging! Determine which basic facts children need to master and then select the cards for one of four skill levels: sums to 10, sums 11 to 18, minuends to 10 and minuends 11 to 18. Players take turns uncovering the board by answering and matching game cards correctly and see the funny antics of delightful monsters.

67953.name: I Spy Alphabet Aquarium
67953.description: Learn letters and beginning letter sounds by matching colorful fish cards to the correct letters or images on the aquarium game board. Three ways to play: match uppercase letters to each other, match uppercase letters to lowercase letters, or match letters to pictures of things with that beginning letter sound. Includes large game board, game cards, markers, and directions.

67954.name: The Ultimate Base
67954.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Whether it’s a castle, a gadget-filled secret headquarters, a starbase in deep space, or something even more unusual, a Base provides both resources for the Player Characters and adventure ideas for the GM. The Ultimate Base is your guide to creating any sort of Base using the HERO System rules, whether it’s a two-room apartment or an entire world.

67955.description:
Official Rules

During the planning phase of a hunt, this card is wild. It counts as whatever animal is being hunted. If it is drawn during the finishing phase of a hunt, it counts as a Nanuk. If it is blocked by an Inuksuk, allowing the hunt to continue, it counts as one animal toward the hunters' total.

When scored, it is wild... it can be used as one animal of any type. It has a Nanuk in the corner, so it also counts toward the "most Nanuks" bonus.

http://www.sjgames.com/nanuk/promo.html
67955.name: Nanuk: 1st Promo Card

67956.name: Tank Attack
67956.description:
"Red Tanks vs Blue Tanks, this game puts you in command of a Tank Division. You must use your supplies carefully and maneuver your Tanks with skill or face defeat. The battlefield is simple, the Tanks are ready. Are you ready?" From the Rulebook

Tank Attack is game for 2 players in a squared board. It uses a combination of piece movement, dice throwing and card playing. The two players try to defeat all the other player's Tanks or reach his HQ. The battle can turn quickly with the use of the supply cards that can grant you an Air Strike, a Team of Engineers to repair broken Tanks or even a very useful Hijacker.

67958.name: Wings of Fury
67958.description:
From the Back of the Box:

Fly with the dragons of Ansalon!

Within the long shadow of the dragon overlords' domains, villainous schemes approach fruition. Only a handful of courageous heroes dare to challenge these ruthless wyrms--and their success or failure will determine the future of Krynn.

"Wings of Fury" provides a wealth of detail about the mightiest creatures of Krynn. The handbook within this box, "Dragonlore," presents details on all aspects of dragonkind, including the following:

-The history of Krynn, told for the first time by its truly epic participants--the dragons.

-Extensive descriptions of the Dragon Realms ruled by the overlords, including the schemes, resources, and weaknesses of each.

-The lore of the ten clans of ancient dragons, including revered elders of each, current strongholds, and traditional enemies and allies.

Wings of Fury also features "Wings Over Ansalon," an adventure that pits the heroes and powerful good dragons against the might of the great red dragon Malys herself! The adventure is playable by itself but also serves as the epic climax to the "Dragons of a New Age" adventure cycle. A full-color poster map details the Dragon Isles, the idyllic realm that has been clanhome to the good dragons for the last fourteen centuries.

Now is the time for the heroes of Krynn to arise and take their stand against evil and destruction--for if the forces of Malys advance unchecked, the end of the world cannot lag far behind.

Wings of Fury uses the SAGA dramatic adventure rules from the DRAGONLANCE: FIFTH AGE boxed set.

As the flying saucers launch from the spaceship, they soar into the air and whirl in gravity-defying acrobatics. Your mission is to catch them in your nets before they land. So get ready to run around and act spacey!"

67969.description: This was a promotional die given away for the 2002 Origins Game Fair in Columbus, OH. It is a pretty standard Diceland die, with a jump special ability, and a weak, weak attack. Horus is a fighter for the Gypsy Queen army.
67969.name: Diceland: Horus Promo Die

67970.name: Terror on the Bozeman Trail: Red Cloud's War
67970.description:
The Bozeman Trail is an epic from Red Cloud's War (1866-1868). As head of American forces, will you assure the security of the colonists, construct a fort, and escort working parties while defending yourself from Indian attack? Will the impetuous Captain W.J. Fetterman break-through the blockade that is strangling your forces more and more each day? Or perhaps you will take on the role of Red Cloud and his warriors: American Horse, Big Road, Brave Eagle, and Crazy Horse! You will harass the Boys in Blue and drive them from the land, while being wary of the power of their weapons. Ambush will be your best weapon, and you may be able to end it all with an assault on the fort itself.

Includes:
17" x 22" map
280 die-cut counters
1 Turn = 3 Months, 1 counter = 1 leader, or 15-20 US soldiers/cavalrymen, or civilians, or 100 Sioux warriors

67971.name: Television Trivia Game
67971.description:
From the back of the box:

Small enough to go anywhere, Television trivia travels well, whether on a trip, in the car for long drives, or over to a friend's house for hours of trivia fun. There are no complex rules or pieces to keep track of - just open and enjoy!

Categories test your knowledge of five great TV decades from the 1950's to the 1990's.

There is no board or any such pieces, There are 5 questions per card (a question about a show from the 50's, 60's, 70's, 80's, and 90's)
You decide how many points you want to play to before starting the game. A correct answer is worth 1 point.

boardgameissuearticle: Pedestrian to the Point of Pain
boardgamehonor: 2010 UK Games Expo Best New Boardgame Winner
67972.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

The Ragnar Brothers return to canal-building in this new game set during the Industrial Revolution, which will be produced in an edition of 1,000 copies. Here's a game description from the back of the box:

"For a brief period the Industrial Revolution burned so bright that Britain was known as the 'Workshop of the World.' This Ragnar Brothers' game recreates that dramatic time. Players establish their position on the map-board by investing in ports, heavy industries, textiles, light industries and crafts. Canal networks are built to connect the thriving towns. Expenditure is vast, but capital gains are greater. Next the railways are built and each player seeks to strengthen their industrial base. By game end, towns are linked from London to Wales, Scotland to the Channel ports. Wealth decides the winner."

And here's the game play described in more detail:

• The game lasts two eras – the Canal Era and Railroad Era – with players earning money at the end of each era.

• Before starting an era, players each reveal one of their two demand tokens to show which towns (ports, textile locations, etc.) have special value.

• Each era lasts a number of rounds, and in each round players reveal town cards equal to the number of players, then hold an auction for turn order. Players choose towns in turn order, placing an Industry marker on that location, then optionally building links from that town, ideally forming a network of links that connects their Industries.

• Once the town cards run out, the era ends. Players (may) reveal their second demand token, then they collect money equal to their revenue (earned by connecting Industries with links), the demand value of their Industries, and the value of their largest network of links, with token payment for any remaining links.

• Between eras, the game is reset Amun-Re-style, with revenues being zeroed out and all links being cleared from the board. Players' Industries remain in place, letting them build on their holdings in the second era, which otherwise plays out nearly identical to the first.
67972.name: Workshop of the World
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Little Metal Dog Show - Episode 5

67973.description:
This game is very similar to Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 505, however the pitcher physically rolls a steel ball to down a pathway on the board and the batter has to push a button that will trap the ball between the 'bat' and a contact. With a successful 'hit' various lights will light up either singly or in combination, indicating the outcome of the play. If the batter misses the ball, the pitch can be a strike if it stops in front of a small rise in the pitching track. If the ball goes past the rise, then it is considered a ball.

This introduces some dexterity into the gameplay rather than the outcome being determined by electronics
67973.name: Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 48-B

67975.name: Starry Wisdom (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Spring 1997)
rpgissuearticle: Mythos Card Winner -  A Simpsons Halloween
The Masters of Space and Time
67975.description:
Special Yithian Issue

Contents:

Words of Wisdom by Dustin Wright
The Masters of Space and Time by Shannon Appel
In The Stars (A List of Upcoming Products)
The Artist's Bazaar (A Marketplace for Mythos prints and Original artwork)
Inside Arachne Piñata by Rob Heinsoo
News from Leng by Dustin Wright
Yithian Mental Contact by Shannon Appel
Is it Dark in Here? by Greg Stafford

67976.description:
From publisher site:

Little hippo chuckles and pokes out his tongue while trying to touch the tip of his nose. The children first turn round an animal card and imitate the snout shown there. Then they try to find the identical animal card. With each error, however, the cheeky monkey Anthony moves one square ahead. Will the children be quicker than Anthony? A co-operative memory game for 2-6 little face acrobats ages 3-8. Includes competition variation.
67976.name: Mimik Memo

67977.name: Politico: The Fall of Caesar
boardgamefamily: Small Box Games Pure Card Line
67977.description:
Politico: The Fall of Caesar is the 7th game in Small Box Games' Pure Card Line.

In Politico: The Fall of Caesar, players are Senators who have grown tired of Caesar, and have aspirations of overthrowing the leader of Rome and taking the reigns. Little did you know that you weren’t the only Senator with such lofty goals, as there are other Senators with a similar agenda. Players secretly plot to gain the most supporters within the city of Rome to help bring their plan to fruition, and to bring about the fall of Caesar, or at the very least, posture themselves in a position of greater power.

The game takes place over a series of rounds. During each round, a new Supporter is revealed and players secretly choose what Tactic they will choose for the round, either to Persuade Supporters of the current type, or to Manipulate the game to their favor. The game ends immediately if any player manages to have 13 or more Supporters, with at least 1 supporter of each type. Otherwise, the game ends after the round when the last Supporter card is revealed, and players are awarded points for the Supporters they have left at the end of the game.

Politico: The Fall of Caesar is not an expansion for Politico. It is a stand alone game that borrows mechanics from the original game.

67979.name: Tempt
boardgamefamily: Small Box Games Pure Card Line
67979.description:
Tempt is the 8th game in Small Box Games Pure Card Line.

In Tempt, players are powerful warlords vying for control of a splintering empire. Players tempt powerful Cohorts to fight for their cause. The fleeting Temptresses grant the players additional special abilities. Tempt is a mix of strategy, tactics, and clever card play. The player controlling the largest portion of the kingdom after the conflict ends, wins the game.

Tempt takes place over several rounds of play. Each round, each player will receive 3 turns. A round always begins with players secretly selecting 2 Temptress cards to aid them for the round. The 3 facedown Cohort decks in the middle of the play area represent 3 areas of the kingdom, and each player controls a Column on his side of each area where he can Tempt powerful Cohorts, in attempts to gain and hold control of that area. The player with the strongest Column has Primacy in that area and is awarded extra points and actions. Cohorts may also be tempted as Chanters, granting the player additional abilities.

Due to the artwork on some of the cards, Tempt is not recommended for gamers under the age of 13.

67980.name: Soundtracks
67980.description:
Contents:
CD
4 game boards
40 counters
Guide

From the box:
"The award winning listening game!

Children will love listening to the real sounds and matching them to the photographs on their game boards. Start the CD anywhere for a different game each time."

Play the sounds on the included CD. Each player tries to identify the sound and the first person to do so places a counter in the corresponding place on their player board. Players race to complete their board. The sounds on the CD are of a wide variety (e.g. transport, animals etc).

67982.description:
Fire Brigade from Haba - Fifo, the fire dragon, is playing with matches. Suddenly, flames are everywhere and the alarm bells are ringing. Who will help the brave firemen fight the blaze? Three suggestions for playing, assigning, puzzling and observing closely. For one child and an adult.

Game & Puzzle: with game and puzzle HABA combines three classic product groups into a new innovative series. The articles each contain three thematically conceived child-adopted game ideas of increasing degree of difficulty. - classifying game aged 2+ - simple dice game aged 3+ - jigsaw puzzle and searching game aged 4+ As children grow they keep on learning and the game ideas of Game & Puzzle therefore continues to be a stimulating toy over a long time.
67982.name: Feuerwehr

67984.name: Hellfrost Canvas Map - Road Warden's Edition
67984.description:
From the publisher website:

Hellfrost fans rejoice! Chart your course over the frozen lands of Rassilon on this beautifully rendered map.

The special collectors map is printed with eco-solvent permanent inks on archival quality canvas, then coated with a professional grade acrylic varnish for added protection, this map will enhance your Hellfrost campaign for years to come!

67987.description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
Be the first player to complete a Cootie character.

Contents
-Instruction booklet
-1 large 6-sided die
-6 cardboard Cootie heads
-6 cardboard Cootie bodies
-6 cardboard Cootie tails

Setup
Put all of the Cootie parts in a pile in the center of the playing surface.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first. Roll the die.

If you roll a Cootie part, take that part from the pile and place it in front of you. If you already have that part, do nothing and pass the die to the next player.

If you roll a picture with 3 Cootie parts you can choose any one of those parts.
If you roll a red "X" you must put one of your parts back in the pile.

If you roll a picture of the die you can take another turn.

2. Pass the die to the next player to the left and follow the same game play.

Note: You can mix different color Cootie parts or keep all the parts the same color.

Winning
The first player to complete his Cootie wins the game. For a longer game, play 3 rounds. The player who wins the most rounds wins that game.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.
67987.name: Mini Cootie

67988.description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
The player to collect the most fish before the ice is broken wins the game.

Contents
-4 tiles with 2 fish on them
-12 tiles with 1 fish on them
-1 penguin tile
-1 broken ice tile
-1 Skating Bear pawn with stand
-Instruction booklet

Setup
1. Remove one 1-fish tile and one 2-fish tile from the game. Shuffle the remaining 16 tiles and arrange them picture side down in a 4x4 grid.
2. Place the Skating Bear next to the tile grid.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first. Place the Skating Bear on any tile.
2. Lift up the bear and turn over the tile. If you see a picture of one or two fish on the tile place it in front of you.
3. Place the Skating Bear in the empty space for the next player to move.
4. Play continues to the left following the same game play.

Turning over the Penguin tile
If you turn over the penguin you must give up one of your fish tiles. Take the tile and put it aside out of play. Your turn is over.

Turning over the Broken Ice tile
If at any time during the game a player turns over the broken ice tile, the game is over. Each player now counts all the fish pictured on their tiles.

Winning
The player with the most fish wins the game. If there is a tie for the most fish then all tied players are winners!

Optional Gameplay
For a quicker game, try a 3x3 tile grid but remember to keep the penguin and broken ice tile in the grid.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.
67988.name: Mini Don't Break the Ice

67989.name: Scales
67989.description:
User Summary:

The Scales rulebook contains everything needed to start a campaign.

The book starts with the rules system, including Gestalt and character creation, occupations and hobbies, action resolution and combat. The game system is designed to be simple and fast, with emphasis on the narrative side of roleplaying rather than straight simulation of actions.

The rest of the book describes the game universe in depth, with chapters about magic, magical beings, technomancers (alchemists who cast spells by using mana drawn from the organs of magical beings), Masks (arts performed by dragons to conceal their use of mana), and a description of the different factions of the game (the thirteen families and three generations of Dragons, awakened magical beings, Technomancers, the Celestial Dragon and his offsprings the Newborns...)

The book ends with a scenario ("keening"), designed to introduce players to their Gestalt.

67990.name: Ecran (Scales)
67990.description:
User Summary:

The Scales gamemaster screen contains a 4 panel screen (with an illustration supposed to give clues about the death of the Dragon Mother), and a 16 pages stapled book describing new magical beings, their powers, and scenario ideas.

67991.name: Manufactura
67991.description:
Manufactura is the game that stimulates the productive processes of a factory and the commercialization of its products to the market. It demonstrates the importance of the Lean production, in other words, it shows the concept of producing in a Lean way. This concept was originated with the Toyota Production System and aims at increasing the speed of the processes, eliminating waste and reducing costs.

In the game, the players are presidents of companies which need to produce their products and sell them to the clients. These clients, however, only buy from companies that offer the lower prices. To offer competitive prices, they will have to improve their factories, which present limited production capacity and serious quality problems. The secret is to produce faster, better and with a lower cost. The person who achieves the greater total income is the winner.

Manufactura may be played by all employees who are part of the productive area of a company, or by those who are just curious about its operational system. With this game, they will all learn and know the Lean culture and its advantages and benefits.

67992.name: Inside ISO 9001
67992.description:
Inside ISO 9001 is the game about the ISO 9001, which provides guidelines on how to administrate and assure the quality of products and processes. This approach allows the company in question to improve its quality and to increase its productivity and its clients’ satisfaction.

While playing, the participants compete against each other on a fictional race to see who is the first to achieve the certification. The players are challenged to answer correctly to ISO 9001 related questions. The person who first reaches the certification, in other words, the end of the path, is the winner.

Inside ISO 9001 is recommended to companies and professionals who are interested on the quality system, or who are facing a certification process. The game is a tool to people who are learning about the ISO 9001 and to those are already acquainted with the process but would like to improve their knowledge. The game can also be used as advertisement and celebration tool for those companies that just conquered the certification.

67993.name: White Belts Combat
67993.description:
White Belts Combat is the board game in which the White Belts duel in a battle of martial arts and of knowledge over the Six Sigma fundaments. The dispute stage is an oriental temple and the winner is the one who combines the best punches with the most precise answers.

The game was developed for combat between two fighters. They get on to a mat and the aim is to throw one’s opponent off it. To do so, one must answer the questions correctly and strike the strongest punch.

White Belts Combat is ideally distributed to company White Belts. With this game, these professionals may deepen, perfect or recycle their knowledge on Six Sigma. Besides, this product aims to promote or revitalize the Six Sigma programs within the organization.

67994.name: Belts Challenge
67994.description:
Belts Challenge is a game of strategy and knowledge. In order to win, the players must combine their strategic skills with a good measure of Six Sigma knowledge.

In this game, each player starts by receiving a card with aims and resources to be applied. The aims are linked to the improvement of the company processes. During the game, the players answer the questions correctly, the resources bet in each round are incorporated into the process and the improvement is therefore made. The players thus get more resources to be applied. If, on the other hand, they answer the questions incorrectly, the resources are wasted, which means that they do not remain in the processes and the players are not entitled to new resources. The winner is the one who first completes the three proposed objectives..

This game’s players are Green Belts and Black Belts and they will have an excellent opportunity to challenge their knowledge and company management resource skills while going after a stipulated objective.

67995.name: Inside 14001
67995.description:
Inside ISO 14001 is the game in which players will have the opportunity to know more about the requirements and characteristics of this norm and will go through the experience of a fictitious certification process through a race. The winner will be the first to reach the final ISO 14001 certification process.

Through this game, players learn what requirements are and get to know some of them, what conformable and non conformable situations are, and players also become aware that it is the people and their attitudes that result in the success of ISO 1400.

This game is interesting for companies that are already ISO 14001 and for those going through the process of becoming ISO 14001.Inside ISO 14001 helps employee awareness and adaptation to the contents and details of this norm.

67996.name: Climate Game
67996.description:
Climate Game is a game which when played with strategy, negotiation and diplomacy, challenges its players to save the world from imminent destruction. With everyone’s effort and awareness, the emission of carbonic gas can be reduced before it is too late.

This game is both one of competition and of cooperation. It promotes competition because the player who emits no carbonic gas at all is the winner. But, integrated work of all the other participants is essential in order not to exceed the gas limits of the greenhouse effect that the planet can put up with. If this limit is exceeded, the Earth’s temperature will have risen to a level where human life is not possible and everyone dies/loses.

Therefore, participants must have a good degree of knowledge regarding gas emission and the greenhouse effect and also be very good at negotiating and formulating strategies.

67997.name: Eco Planet
67997.description:
Eco Planet is a board game aimed at environment preservation awareness. The players have a race to see who gets to Eco Planet first, which is an ecologically tolerable place. In order to get there, the players must know the causes, effects, consequences and solutions for the planet’s degradation.

There are five theme groups: air, water, soil, global warming and environmental awareness. When a player gets the correct answers to the questions asked about the theme he/she is on, he/she moves forward on the board.

Eco Planet may be distributed to employees, clients, suppliers, partners and to the community for the promotion of the planet preservation idea. This game can and must be taken home and played with the whole family and with friends.

http://www.games4b.com/ecoplanet.php

67998.name: Zhi Ji Zhi Bi
67998.description:
It is a card game.
The aim of this game is to identify and eliminate your ennemies.

At the beginning, the four players receive one card. It will determine which team you are part of (Blue Ying Yang or Red Ying Yang). Players should keep theirs secret.

At your turn, you had to play a card :

- hit someone (10 pts, 20 pts, 30 pts)
- heal someone
- protect someone
- identify someone

You can't heal or protect yourself.
When someone has been hit for an amount of more than 101 pts, he must reveal his identity and he is dead.

67999.name: O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA
67999.description:
O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo que fala sobre a CIPA Comissão Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes. Essa norma tem como objetivo a prevenção de acidentes e doenças decorrentes do trabalho, de modo a tornar compatível permanentemente o trabalho com a preservação da vida e a promoção da saúde do trabalhador.

No jogo os participantes concorrem para ver quem será o primeiro a atravessar a trilha da CIPA. Para avançar no tabuleiro é necessário acertar as perguntas que falam dos vários temas: principais normas regulamentadoras, equipamentos de proteção, mapa de risco, classe de fogo, universo CIPA e áreas da fábrica. Durante o jogo, os papeis desempenhados pelos participantes, que são os mesmos na CIPA de verdade, vão se alternando, o que aumenta a emoção do jogo.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é um jogo que deve ser distribuído para os cipeiros e para os funcionários das empresas como forma de conscientização para os perigos e os riscos do ambiente de trabalho, assim como para a educação do uso dos equipamentos de segurança individual ou coletiva. É um jogo que pode ser distribuído como brinde nas SIPATs (Semana Interna de Prevenção de Acidentes do Trabalho), em eleições da CIPA, ou mesmo em aniversários e comemorações relacionadas às metas de segurança da empresa.

Assim, o Quem Sabe PartiCIPA é o jogo ideal para a promoção da cultura da segurança do trabalho. Lembre-se que acidentes podem ser prevenidos pelo seu conhecimento e atitude! A segurança de todos depende de você e do treinamento da sua equipe. Bom jogo.


O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the game that talks about the CIPA Committee for the Prevention of Accidents. This standard aims at preventing accidents and illnesses resulting from work in order to make it compatible to work permanently with the preservation of life and the promotion of occupational health.

In the game the participants compete to see who will be the first to cross the path of CIPA. To advance on the board, you must set the questions that speak of various subjects: major regulatory standards, protective equipment, risk map, class of fire, the universe and CIPA areas of the factory. During the game, the roles played by participants, which are the same in real CIPA, will be switching, which increases the excitement of the game.

O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is a game that should be distributed to the accident prevention commission and employees of companies such as awareness of the dangers and risks of the workplace, as well as for the education of use of safety equipment individually or collectively. It is a game that can be distributed as a gift in SIPATs (Week for the Prevention of Accidents at Work), in elections of CIPA, or even birthdays and celebrations related to the security goals of the company.

Thus, knowing O Quem Sabe PartiCIPA is the ideal game for the promotion of culture of safety. Remember that accidents can be prevented by their knowledge and attitude! The safety of all depends on you and training your team. Good game.

68000.name: The Heart of Amun Khonshu
68000.description:
From the back cover:

It all started simply enough, just like your last adventure, and perhaps even the one before that. There you were, in a tavern, when someone you'd never met before approached you with a promise of great wealth complicated only by just a little danger.

"Good people, I beseech you: Hear my story. My name is Allyn, and someone dear to me has suffered a tremendous atack upon his very soul. He now lies on the verge of death.

"As a child, I was fascinated by a story of an enchanted ruby with the power to bring a lost soul back from the dead. I have traveled far and wide in pursuit of many different and amazing treasure, but I have only recently discovered that this story may be true and that the ruby might actually exist.

"You see, many hundreds of years ago - in the region we now call the Great Desert of Ninva - there ruled a wicked man named Amun Khonshu. Some say he was a powerful sorcerer, others say he was a god. In searching for this fabled ruby, I have found that this region did not become a desert until after this vile man died. Once his vast power was taken with him into the afterlife, its horrible absence left a terrible blight upon the land.

"Regardless of the effects of his disappearance, Amun Khonshu was a murderer and a tyrant who ruled over the people of these lands by a fanatical death cult dedicated to his advancement. Fortunately, upon Amun Khonshu's death, his cult was driven underground and eventually destroyed by neighboring nations. But before the cult was vanquished, the servants of Amun Khonshu managed to preserve their leader's body and seal it away in a secret tomb, along with his vast store of ill-gotten treasure. Legend has it that they left the enchanted ruby there as well, to guide his soul back to his mortal frame.

"Good people, I believe I have found the location of this tomb, but my own band of associates was sadly not up to the task of surmounting the perils of the Ninva Desert. I beg you, please help me find the Heart of Amun Khonshu to save my friend. If you do, all of the treasure of that tomb, save the ruby, is yours -- all of it!

"What say you?"

67501.name: Coeur de Lion
67501.description: Wargaming rules for the Crusades era, 1000-1300 A.D. Ground scale is 1 inch = 10 yards. Figure scale is 1 figure = 20 men. Time scale is 1 turn = 15 minutes real time. 28 pages.

Bug Hunt - A Battlelords adventure

67504.description:
From the web site:

"Dark Spell is a complete rules system based around sorcery, spell-casting, and combat. It contains rules for character creation, game mechanics, and a spell listing."

No weapons, equipment, monsters, setting, or other information is given. This is a bare-bones RPG which would be most suitable for wizard vs wizard combat.

rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th & 6th Editions)
67506.description:
Volume 4, No. 6

Causoban - A city chock-full of bad guys for Earthdawn


The remaining table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

67509.name: Questions pour un Champion
67509.description:
Questions pour un Champion is a French game based on the TV show of the same name. Played from 3 to 5 players it is a game that tests both your knowledge and your reflex.

In the first round all the players are obliged to answer questions by pushing a special button before anyone else does. The goal is to score 9 points which takes a player to the second round. The player that didn't reach 9 points when everyone else did is eliminated.

In the second round each remaining player chooses one of four proposed subjects and has to answer questions related to it. The maximum score here is 4 points (for 4 consecutive correct answers). The best two players go through to the final.

In the last round the two remaining players are face to face, having to find the answer for some long questions read by the presenter. The players may score 4, 3, 2 or 1 point, based on the number of information given by the presenter. The first player to score 9 points is the winner.

67512.name: Intervention Divine
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67512.description:
User Summary:

Intervention Divine is a mix of scenarios, background and gamemaster aids for INS/MV:

- 2 scenarios for demon characters: "Tout ça, c'est du cinéma!" and "Le casse du siècle"

- 2 scenarios for angel characters: "Cette manie que vous avez, vous les moniteurs de natation, de vouloir toujours tout dramatiser" and "Philippins partagent le pain, Philippines partagent la..."

- a scenario for human characters set in the 1920s: "Satan m'habite"

- chapters about the children conceived by a human and a supernatural being (angel or demon), what happens to the souls of killed characters (and their victims), rules for Soldiers of God (including battle hymns), some NPCs and rules errata.

67513.name: Starblade Battalion Mekton
67513.description:
"From the ashes of the Cyberpunk Age, through ecological holocaust and the spectre of extinction, Humanity has finally risen, like a phoenix, to conquer the stars." - from the back cover.

Set aproximately 150 years after the world of Cyberpunk 2020, humanity is divided between two powerful factions: an Earth dominated government led by "eco-zealots" and a coalition of megacorporations that rule the outworlds of the Pleiades. The players are put in the position of trying to carve out a middle ground between these two extremist factions. - user summary of the Designer's Intro to the book

67514.name: Daemonis Compendium
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67514.description:
User Summary:

Daemonis Compendium contains 48 laminated information sheets and a 16 pages stapled book wrapped in a faux leather case.

Each sheet presents an Archangel or a Demon Prince, with a short story, character and special powers description, avatar stats, and his opinions on his subordinates and colleagues.

The book describes some of the power struggles in the Angelic Council andits Infernal counterpart, and a scenario for In Nomine Satanis.

67515.name: Demonix Remix
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67515.description:
User Summary:

Demonix Remix is a scenario book for INS/MV.

There are two scenarios for Magna Veritas ("Arrête de sucer mon gros crayon" and "Il y a quelque chose de pourri dans le royaume de Chatel-Les-Roses"), one scenario for In Nomine Satanis ("Pourquoi les castors ont la queue plate"), two scenarios playable by angel or demon characters ("Accroche-toi au pinceau, j'enlève l'échelle" and "C'est Lundi, C'est Ravioli") and articles about the powers of holy buildings ("Advanced Clochers & Cathédrales"), the Archangel Janus and the Demon Prince Valefor, and several NPCs.

67516.name: 4th Edition Player's Handbook Collection
67516.description:
This is a box set containing the Dungeons & Dragons (4th Edition) Player's Handbook (D&D 4e) and the Player's Handbook 2 (D&D 4e).

From the publisher's website:

Two Books, One Great Price

The Player's Handbook and Player's Handbook 2 contain all of the rules, classes, races, feats, skills, and items any player of D&D will ever need. Gathered together in a handsome slip-case, this special holiday collection offers both books at one great price!

This great holiday offering is just the thing for either the new or the dedicated gamer in your life!

67517.name: Baron Samedi
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67517.description:
User Summary:

Baron Samedi is a campaign for INS/MV. It introduces voodoo cults and powers in the game.

The six scenarios are "Brunasse pétasse", "Ca bourre à Cabourg", "Agadou, dou, dou, pousse l'ananas et mouds l'café", "Matelas Epéda multi-spears", "Roger ! Un petit blanc sec", and "Oh, moi vous savez je les préfère sans sucre".

The book also contains all the rules related to voodoo: initiates (Tontons Macoutes) and priests (Béké or Mambo) character creation, powers, magic items...

67520.description:
(from MMP's website :)

The ASL Journal #8 is a 60-page magazine of nothing but articles, scenarios, and support materials for Advanced Squad Leader.

The Table of Contents for ASL Journal #8 looks like this:


Carl Nogueira shows you the proper way to grease the treads of your tank in Crosstown Traffic — a detailed look at the rules for Vehicular Overrun.
Mark Pitcavage teaches new ASL players how to lose some of that new player shine in The Agony of Defeat.
Lars Thuring and Tuomo Lukkari take us on a tour of the upcoming Finn module Hakkaa Päälle!
Matt Shostak provides a detailed scenario analysis of scenario J74 Priests on the Line
David Olie shows you what you can do at setup with all that cool stuff you get on your scenario card in A Place For Your Stuff.
Jim Stahler gives us a detailed breakdown of the scenarios in Turning The Tide.
Ian Daglish provides designer's notes on the conception and birth of Action Pack 4: Normandy 1944.
Bret Hildebran and J.R. Tracy take us on a detailed look at their defensive setups for scenario J113 Maczek Fire Brigade


And there are 16 ASL scenarios:

J113 Maczek Fire Brigade (Novy Targ, Poland, 4 September 1939); Germans vs. Polish
J114 The Marketplace at Wormhoudt (Wormhoudt, France, 28 May 1940); Germans vs. British
J115 Last Push to Mozhaisk (Mozhaisk, Russia, 17 October 1941); Germans vs. Russians
J116 Brigade Hill (Efogi, Papua, 8 September 1942); Japanese vs. Australian
J117 The Triangle (Buna Mission, Papua, 21 November 1942); Japanese vs. Americans
J118 Elephants Unleashed (Ponyri, Russia, 5 July 1943); Germans vs. Russians
J119 Sovkhoz Haystacks (Telman Sovkhoz, Crimea, 28 January 1944); Germans vs Russians
J120 Ishun Tank Traps (Ishun, Crimea, 11 April 1944); Germans vs. Russians
J121 Schloss Hemingstein (Brandscheid, Germany, 14 September 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J122 Bloody Bois Jacques (Bastogne, Belgium, 22 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J123 Charging Chaumont (Chaumont, Belgium, 23 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J124 The Cobra Kings (Assenois, Belgium, 25 December 1944); Germans vs. Americans
J125 Everything is Lost (Berlin, Germany, 30 April 1945); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 19 Cellar Dwellars (Central Stalingrad, 17 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 20 Terror at Twilight (Central Stalingrad, 18 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians
VotG 21 Defending the Voentorg (Central Stalingrad, 22 September 1942); Germans vs. Russians
67520.name: ASL Journal #8

67521.name: MindStorm
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67521.description:
User Summary:

Mindstorm adds psionic powers and renegade angels and demons to INS/MV.

Psis are humans who have developed mental powers. They're not affiliated to Good or Evil, they have their own goals and most of them are employed by corporations called "Trusts". Renegades are angels or demons who decide to quit, and either join the other side of the Great Game or just try to be left alone (which won't happen, since neither Archangels nor Demon Prince like traitors).

The book contains all the rules needed to create and play a psi character, rules for trusts and the high-tech gear they develop, a chapter describing the consequences of becoming a renegade, two scenarios ("Turlututu, chapeau pointu, tu l'as dans le c..." and "Basile, il y a un éléphant dans ma cathédrale"), and a chapter describing compatibilities between the different forces of the game (angels, demons, psis, voodoo, vikings, sorcerers...)

67522.name: Shadis (Issue 25 - Mar 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Close Encounters of the Random Kind
Ferals: A New Yogang for CyberGeneration
The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly

Volume 4, No. 7

Cover by Susan Van Camp

The featured article is:


... And Jack Left Town - Those meddling kids! For Cybergeneration


The remaining table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

67523.name: Mors Ultima Ratio
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67523.description:
User Summary:

Mors Ultima Ratio is a campaign for INS/MV set in a pocket universe created by Beleth, Demon Prince of Nightmares. The pocket universe, nicknamed "Gothic Horror" is a nightmarish version of 1920's france, complete with werewolves, black magic and haunted villages.

The campaign contains seven scenarios, three are for angels ("Appelez-moi Pablo", "Fièvre lupine", "Le musée des horreurs"), three for demons ("Flic ou zombi?", "I'm bleeding in the rain" and "Copains comme cochons"), and the last one ("Une porcherie trop loin") ends the campaign and is playable by both sides.

Crude Oil - Cthulhu and oil drilling; you figure out the connection

67525.name: Discomfort
rpgseries: DRAG - Living Forgotten Realms Dragon Coast Regional Adventures
67525.description:
Adventure Teaser:
The body found floating in the harbor belongs to one of the Fire Knives, and now a gang war looms on the horizon. What will you do when you discover the truth about the death? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the Dragon Coast for characters 11-14. Part of the Pain and Suffering major quest, which continues in CORM2-2 Pain (level 11-14) and concludes in DALE2-2 Agony (level 14-17).

67528.name: No Quarter (Issue 6 - May 2006)
67528.description:
From website:

No Quarter #6 showcases a preview of the Five Fingers setting for the Iron Kingdoms, a detailed look at the Mauler, plus the introduction of Centurions, the Hammerfall, and mercenary warcaster Ashlynn D'Elyse.

67529.name: No Quarter (Issue 7 - Jul 2006)
67529.description:
From website:

No Quarter #7 features the Lion's Coup exclusive comic, secrets of the Circle of Orboros, the creation of Druid constructs, and the bodger's bag of tricks.
