Drawn & Quartered Battle Report - Games and Comics...& Stuff
Faith and Sacrifice (Sul, Theater of War)
Foundry, Forge, & Crucible - Black Ogrun's Forge
Guts & Gears - The Wolves of Orboros and Crusader
HORDES - Deadly Duo's Double the Love
Modeling and Painting - CHARGE! Painting cavalry in the Iron Kingdoms
The Birth of Formula P3 Paints
The Pendrake Encounters - Ghosts of the Past
The Poop Deck - Khador comes a callin'
67530.description:
From website:

No Quarter #8 features the Sul Theater of War campaign, HORDES warloack tactics, and the Scrutator and Exemplar classes for your Iron Kingdoms campaign.

Cover Art "Exemplar Venger" by Kendrick Lim

ISSN: 7558200197

67531.name: No Quarter (Issue 9 - Nov 2006)
rpgissuearticle: By the Light of a Blood Moon
67531.description:
From website:

No Quarter #9 provides rules for building themed armies, a two-player HORDES Campaign with new terrain rules, and new rules for the guns of the Iron Kingdoms.

67532.name: Space Cadets
67532.description:
From the Back Cover

Space Cadets(tm) takes your TWERPS(tm) game to the wackiest limits of outer space! Explore alien worlds, seek out weird and ugly life-forms, and blast them! Included are 5 new character classes including Mechanics and Medics, new Sci-fi weapons, defenses, vehicles, equipment, alien monsters, and lots more! The companion volume, Rocket Rangers(tm), provides complete rules for spaceship construction and combat.

This is a campaign set for the TWERPS(tm) game system. The TWERPS(tm) Basic Rules are needed for play.

67533.name: Shadis (Issue 29 - Oct 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Anatomy of a Haunting - "Real life" ghosts to enhance your campaign
The Case of the Missing Player
67533.description:
Month of publication unspecified

Volume 5, No. 4

Cover by Matt Wilson

The featured article is:


Black Curtain Theater - A complete adventure for Vampire: the Masquerade


The remaining table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

67534.name: Il Etait Une Fois
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67534.description:
User Summary:

Il était une fois contains scenarios and gamemaster aids about Space-Time Continuum travel.

After a short explanation of time travelling and parallel universes and a presentation of the means of travel used by the different factions, the book offers four scenarios to take the players to different times and places:

- "Alouette, gentille alouette" has a team of angel characters sent to protect Joan of Arc

- "Accroche-toi aux clous, j'enlève l'échelle" asks a team of angels to make sure the crucifixion of Jesus happens

- "Reviens Georges, j'ai les mêmes à la maisons" (for demons or viking characters) is about saving the last dragon and the last fey folk from the armies of Georges, Archangel of Purification

- "Le Pouvoir Derrière La Croix" (also for demons) has the players take part in an Inquisition tribunal in 1322 in order to save a jewish merchant

The book also contains three new Archangels (Catherine Archangel of Women, Georges Archangel of purification, and Jesus Archangel of God - yes, you get stats for Jesus).

67535.name: Insh Allah
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67535.description:
User Summary:

Insh Allah explains the role of Islam in the INS/MV alternate earth.

The book contains details about the history behind Islam, its place in the Great Game between god and lucifer, how to create islamic angels and demons, three islamic Archangels and three islamic Demon Princes, and three scenarios, "Les carottes sont que huit" for angels or demons, "F.I.S. de pute" also for angels or demons and "L'envol", only for angels.

67537.name: Les Frères de la Nuit
67537.description:
User Summary:

This sourcebook for Bloodlust describes the guilds, sects and secret societies of Tanaephis in great details. Each description takes at least 4 pages and may include maps, famous NPCs, scenarios ideas...

The book also contains a summary of the Eclat de Lune campaign, and its consequences (geopolitics, technology, economy...)

67538.name: The Metabarons Universe Guide
67538.description:
User Summary (derived from product text and Introduction):

Fans of The Incal and The Metabarons, rejoice! For the first time anywhere, Alexander Jodorowski, co-creator of The Incal and The Metabaron, reveals never-before-seen details about the amazing universe of the Metabaron. Learn the secret histories of the Human Empire, the Shabda-Oud Sisterhood, and the parallel universes that surround our own. Explore the alliances and conspiracies that hold the Empire together (and threaten to tear it apart). Learn why the Necro-Dream is so dangerous, and how close Mankind stands to ultimate oblivion.

The Universe Guide sheds new light on many aspects of daily life in the Human Empire, and delves into the structure and organization of the Imperial Government (the Senate, the Noble Houses, the Techno-Pontificate, the Ekonomat, and the Maganats), the Mentreks, the Endogaurd, the Shabda-Oud, the Metabaron, and the Colonials. Also covered are secret societies, cults and religions, notable planets, The Golden Palace of the Emperoress, the Imperial Navy, and the limitations and hazards of hyperspace travel.

Extensive sections on the history of the universe include a time-line of events for the "The Incal" and "The Metabarons," tracing the growth of the empire and the family of the Metabaron. Players of The Metabarons Roleplaying Game will find a wealth of new character templates and professions, new rules for aliens and mutants, new weapons and cybernetics, a detailed anatomy of a typical Endocity, new vehicles and robots, resources for creating exciting galaxy-spanning adventures, and at long last, the hidden secrets of the Metabunker, the invincible fortress of the Metabarons.

The first edition of the Metabarons Universe Guide was published (in French) in 2001. The English translation for the abridged .PDF version was provided by Diane Bertrand, Justin Kelly, and Joan Wilchins. Thank you for your work!

The .PDF version includes the following note.

Note to Readers:
The Abridged PDF (English) version of the Universe Guide was created from the original electronic files. Selected images and text were left out or modified, and the page layout was modified to reduce file size and production time. This electronic document was conceived as a relatively inexpensive means for people to get information about the Metabarons Universe that was previously unavailable. This PDF requires the Metabarons Roleplaying Game Rule Book to play.

67539.description:
From the designer's website:

Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki is a tactical wargame for two to four players.

Players battle for control of various objective zones, using one of four factions: the Daiseep, Humans, Khelons, and Saahrai. Each force is commanded by one or two Heroes, and features a number of Troopers and/or Vehicles. In the advanced game mode, players can select armoury cards to provide their units or their whole force with unique abilities.

Crystal Core features simulated parallel play through the use of command cards, which are selected simultaneously by each player, and define what actions are available for that round. Players must devise a plan for each round, and execute it with a focus on army-cohesion and maneuvering for prime position to achieve victory.

The game also provides a superior wargaming experience by eliminating several of the upkeep actions associated with wargames, including model-per-model movement, excessive dice rolls, and army wide actions, thereby providing maximum entertainment in a modest timeframe.
67539.name: Crystal Core: Battle for Nih'ki
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

67540.name: Le Signe du Serpent
67540.description:
User Summary:

Le signe du Serpent is a campaign for Légendes, it contains two books and a screen. The first book describes the campaign: the characters accept the challenge of a visiting bard and leave their tribe, to find and defeat a powerful sorcerer of the Hyperboreal Isles and come back with an artifact called the Serpent Sign.

The characters will have to travel across Gaul, hire a ship to Ireland, seek the help of the Fianna in order to reach the Hyperboreal Isles, and finally find the Lost World and the serpent-men volcano, where their quest objective is hidden.

The screen coming with the game contains important plans, and the second book is full of illustrations, maps and rule summaries.

67541.name: L'Œil de Balor
67541.description:
User Summary:

L'Oeil de Balor is a scenario for Légendes. After successfully repelling a Formoîré invasion, the hero Gandiorix takes the head of the enemy leader, a sorcerer, as a trophy. During the celebrations, the head opens its third eye, and tells a prophecy stating that next solar eclipse, Gandiorix's son will become the sorcerer's son and turn Formoîré. It's up to the players' characters, with the help of the tribe druid, to find a way to lift the curse.

67542.description:
Far away, in a land called Essentia, two Orders of spell casters have fought for the territory’s possession through the years. Sworn enemies, the Wizards of Dawn and the Sorcerers of Twilight strive for their opponents’ end in every battle. But the number of magicians is small and their life is priceless, so they do not fight on their own but by means of golems under their command.

These battles are carried out on a strange zone where a special magic named essence provides the golems with new powers. That place, called The Changing Land, consists of several different terrains: plains, plateaus, rocks, forests and mountains. There also exist other weird zones, such as springs and circles of essence. Every magic terrain gives a certain magic power to whom tread on it so that it allows them to move or attack in different ways.

Today, one more struggle is about to begin. A skilled wizard of Dawn and a clever sorcerer of Twilight are the chosen ones to handle the golems to solve the battle.

The game includes:

- Organic cotton case (Format 1).
- A4 flexible pad board.
- 28 printed and laser-cut tiles.
- 16 dark onyx laser-cut acrylic golems.
- 16 translucent white laser-cut acrylic golems.
- Rulesheet.
67542.name: Essentia

67543.name: Scriptarium Veritas
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67543.description:
User Summary:

This book is a compilation of material from different other books for INS/MV, most of which were already unavailable at the time Scriptarum Veritas was published.

The first part of the book contains data for all the known Archangels, Demon Princes (catholic as well as muslim) a,d viking gods using the Daemonis Compendium format: a short story, avatar stats, special powers, philosophy, summoning components, sometimes an extra bit of trivia.

The second part of the book contains the complete rules for vikings, voodoo, sorcerers, islam, holy buildings, and chapters about the Army of God, the infernal hierarchy, children of supernatural beings and humans, and "life" after death.

67544.name: Trivia in a Trunk: The Holiday Trivia Game
67544.description:
From the back of the box: "The ultimate trivia fan's stocking stuffer. Everything from your favorite carols to holiday movies, tradition and history. A game for the whole family to play during the Ho-Ho-Holidays!"

Comes with 200 cards, each has three questions (one in each of the following categories: Trees, Candles, Bells. Hint the category names are not too intuitive. For instance "Candles" focuses on Holiday Movies & TV Specials.

An additional twist has a "Take 2" on some questions meaning that in order to score points you have to answer both parts correctly.

67545.name: Consensus Music Edition
67545.description:
Description from BoardgameNews

Consensus Music Edition uses the same game play as the other Consensus titles released by Mindlogic: Ten things are laid out on the gameboard – song titles in this case of this game – then players are presented with a category, such as "Song most likely to be on Bill Clinton's iPod," and secretly choose one thing that they think best represents the category. If you match someone else's answer, you scoot ahead on the path to victory. All things chosen by a player, whether matched or not, are removed from the gameboard and replaced with new cards. The first player to reach the end of the path wins.

67546.name: Pyramid (Issue 28 - Nov 1997)
67546.description:
Contents

A Minor Emergency by Gene Seabolt
The Unity War by Stephen Kenson
Call of Computer by Joshua Marques
Pyramid Picks

Groo: The Card Game
Champions: New

67547.name: Pyramid (Issue 29 - Jan 1998)
67547.description:
Contents

Hour of the Knife by Christopher Jones
Gentleman Johnson's Fish Mart by Ed Wisniowski
Fire and Blood by S.A. Fisher
Hell Jobs by Alain Dawson

67548.name: Principality:  A Choir of Angels
67548.description:
Publisher's website:

In Principality, players lead the angelic Hosts of heaven in an exciting and challenging battle against the dark Deceivers and their fiendish minions.

Now, the Choir of Angels expansion set presents a host of all-new heavenly protectors to add to your Principality base set. Introducing Emerald and Pearl Angels and archangels to reinforce the original Blue and Gold host. A Choir of Angels also presents a slippery new Deceiver and its two twisted minions!

Just as in the Principality base set, the angelic hosts of heaven battle demons called deceivers. Players play as team of angels – gold, blue, pearl, and emerald. (the addition of two new color teams of angels expands this game to 4 player) The first player to capture 3 of the 5 Deceiver cards wins the game.

67549.name: Pyramid (Issue 30 - Mar 1998)
67549.description:
The final print issue.

Contents

Acquiring Respect by John M. Ford and Phil Masters
Survival of the Fittest by Stephen Kenson
Gothic Surf Shop by John Kelly (or Mike Kelly — diffeent name on article than in table of contents)
Heavenly Hell Jobs by Alain Dawson
Autoduel Japan by Mike Montesa
Pyramid Picks

Blue Planet
Heavy Gear Computer Game
Big Eyes, Small Mouth
Postal
Crisis of Faith
Pierced Heart
Evolution
Usagi Yojimbo Roleplaying Game

We're Reading Your Mail

Convention Calendar
Index to Advertisers

67551.name: Tales of Titans
67551.description:
Adventure fantasy board game system.

Welcome to world where each intelligent race worship titans as gods. Brave Humans, Dare Trolls, Furious Orcs still at war with Deceitful Centaurs, Little Kobolds digging earth and Noble Werecats. All of them will face threat of Dark Titan cult.

First scenario: Trials
In first scenario players will be able to lead four different characters: the chosen ones: Human swordsman, Human wizard apprentice, Troll hunter and Troll shaman, to complete series of tasks to please their Titan.

Highlights:
- modular board (each game can be different)
- game system with open world allowing easy prepare new scenarios, new encounters, new rewards
- brand new fight system
- competition play with cooperation elements
- best ideas from WoW:TBG, WoW:TAG, Runebound and Descent:RTL in one with some unseen solutions.
- different in gamefactions and reputation system
- different style of play for each character (swordsman with combo points, shaman with totems)

More information on blog:
http://bri-gryplanszowe.blogspot.com/

67552.description:
User Summary:
The first official supplement for Warzone which includes new heroes and villains from the Mutant Chronicles universe, as well as revised close combat rules, new weapons/equipment, units, and rules for specialized forces (AI, Necrotechnology, etc).

From the back of the book:
Warzone
Dawn of War
In Nomine Cardinalis
The solar system is a roaring mayhem of death and war. The surfaces of the inner planets have been swept clean by the violent onslaught of the Dark Legion's storming hordes of Nepharites, Necromutants, Razides, Pretorian Stalkers and Undead Legionnaires. The human corporations have offered fierce resistance, but divided they fall...
67552.name: Warzone: Dawn of War

67553.name: Ecran (In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas second edition)
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (2nd Edition)
67553.description:
User Summary:

The gamesmaster screen for INS/MV second edition contains a four-panel screen and a 16 pages stapled book with a scenario for a team of demons, "Thalassauce Béarnaise". The characters have ten days to spread evil and sin through a small town in Normandy.

67554.name: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (second edition)
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (2nd Edition)
67554.description:
User Summary:

The second edition of INS/MV is a hardcover book. The game background homogeneously includes all the elements previously published in expansion books and the rules have been streamlined.

The book includes a description of the game universe, the rules system, two chapters about character creation (one for angels and one for demons), a list of Archangels and Demon Princes, a detailed list of powers, and eight scenarios (four for each faction): "Une de perdue, tu l'as dans le c.. !", "Les contes d'apéro", "Subway", "Faut pas être Mickey à Eurodisney", "Boum Boum La Guerre!", "Les esquimaux vont au cinéma pour se faire sucer", "C'est en smurfant qu'on devient schtroumpferon" and "Cette mission, si vous l'acceptez..."

67555.name: L'esprit d'escalier
67555.description:
Designer's Summary:

L'esprit d'escalier is a free-form dialog-driven role playing game. There is no game master, and the game introduces a new role in game mechanics: the scene owner. The role of scene owner is passed around the table clockwise or anti-clockwise.

The scene owner sets a scene between themselves and the next player in line to be scene owner, in which a conflict is covered. After the scene the second player acts out a monologue, detailing what he or she should have said and done.

67556.name: Atlas Germanique
67556.description:
User Summary:

Atlas Germanique is a french sourcebook for Hawkmoon; it describes Germany, Sweiss, Hollandia and Ostrich.

Each of these countries is described in detail: geography, history, political and military organization, religion, science and knowledge, important characters, interesting places to visit, scenario ideas...

The book also includes a few new rules, new weapons and a new Granbretan order, the Order of the Bat, specialized in commando operations.

67557.name: Chroniques Germaniques
67557.description:
User Summary:

Chroniques Germanique contains two scenarios and a campaing for Hawkmoon, all set Germany.

"L'héritage des Von Löwen" (45 pages) is a five acts campaign set before the Granbretan conquest of Germany. The characters have to find the heir of a fief in bayern and avoid the attentions of the Genetic Knights, the German judicial system, a hitman, and more.

"L'Effet Papillon" (19 pages) is an adventure in western sweiss.

"Le Chevalier Boursouflé" (21 pages) is an investigation during a mysterious plague epidemy in a village in Ostrich.

67558.name: Stella Inquisitorus
67558.description:
User Summary:

Stella Inquisitorus describes the In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas 5000 years into the future. It can be used with INS/MV or as a standalone game.

The book contains:
- A chronology of events between 1993 and 6993
- The rule system (the same as INS/MV 2nd edition, with only a few changed powers)
- New rules for vehicles and spaceships
- A detailed description of the organization of the forces of Good (the Stella Vaticanum) and the forces of Evil (the Dunkle Reik), including information on the most important Archangels and Demon Princes
- A short chapter describing what has happened to the third force (muslims, psis, sorcerers, vikings...)
- Three short scenarios, one for each faction and a third designed as an introduction to the Stella Inquisitor universe for INS/MV characters.

67559.name: Strychnine IV
67559.description:
User Summary:

Strychnine IV describes a solar system where angels, demons and vikings have been at war for the most part of the last 5000 years.

Each planet has a detailed description and a scenario.

Haven I used to be an agricultural colony before being destroyed by a spaceship crash. Now it's an uninhabitable mass grave said to be haunted (but still fought over by zealous Stella Vaticanum officers and demons).

Virus II is a green planet, but its flora doesn't like the idea of offworlders and technology and is quite capable of defending itself. The planet is occupied by feral humans, and a few demons and angels sent to study the anti-technology properties of the planet who have become stranded.

Cryo III is an ice planet settled by vikings who have turned it into a fortress.

Strychnine IV, the poison planet, is a permanent warzone. It used to be an industrial world, but thousands of years of pollution and warfare have turned it into a desolate place. Neither Stella Vaticanum nor Dunkle Reik has succeeded in taking control of the planet, but each keep sending troops in the hope of finally breaking the stalemate. It has become a favorite testing ground for new weapons and tactics for each faction of the conflict.

Hellraiser is a marooned Dunkle Reik spaceship orbiting the sun.It was a prototype battleship (five times bigger than any other ship) that was half destroyed when a Stella Vaticanum battleship rammed it to prevent its escape. Both factions are still fighting inside the two ships, and the environment has given birth to strange mutated fungus in the former hydroponics labs, and undead creatures roam the ship freely, unhindered by the lack of air or radiation shielding.

The book also includes a some new equipment and creatures.

67560.name: ICONS Superpowered Roleplaying
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best New Game - Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: Gareth Skarka talks ICONS and Far West and More!
Heroes Zone #1: Land of the Free, Part 1
67560.description:
From the publisher's website:

What kid raised in recent generations hasn’t pretended to be a superhero at some point: worn a cape, flown around, bounced imaginary bullets or shot blasts of power from hands or eyes? Why not? After all, the superhero is the perfect modern fantasy: powerful, respected, and loved by the public, but with a message of responsibility, duty, truth, and justice that appeals to parents as well as kids. In countless comic books (and now graphic novels), cartoons, and live-action television shows and films, superheroes continue to thrill and capture our imagination while also celebrating some of our better qualities. Who wouldn’t want to be a hero?

With ICONS, you can be!

Steve Kenson, the designer of the best-selling Mutants & Masterminds delivers a superpowered new role-playing game, inspired by the fast-playing old-school games and the new generation of narrative role-play! Within its pages are complete rules for character creation, abilities and powers, random adventure generation, a rogue's gallery of villains, a complete adventure and all the superheroic action you can handle!

67561.name: Pseudo-Dragen (Issue 1 - Aug 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Et dansk fanzine for FantasyRoleplayingGames, hvoffer nu det
Over disken - The Palladium RPG Book II: Old Ones
67561.description:
Index:
1 Forside (Front page)
2 Leder (Editorial)
3 Pseudo-vejledning i læsning af "Pseudo-Dragen"
4 Gemte Skatte: Jærvens Kløer (Hidden Teasures: Claws of Wolverine)
7 Hvordan man skaffer 500 orker (How to get 500 orks)
10 Hvorfor spille med figurer (Why play with miniatures)
12 Tegneserie: Den Sorte Hjelm (Comic: The Black Helmet)
14 Over disken: Anmeldelser - The Palladium RPG: Book II: Old Ones (Over the counter: Reviews)
16 Pseudo-Nyheder: Usikre & udetaljerede nyheder, sladder og rygter (Pseudo-News - Unsure & undetailed news, gossip and rumors)
18 Det Zurianske Marked (The Zurian Market)
18 Rejsende (Travellers: contacts)
19 Nyheder (News)
22 Forretninger (Shops)
23 I næste nummer (Next issue)
24 Bagsiden (Rear page)

67562.name: Coming of the Storm
67562.description:
Excerpt from the back of the book:

Coming of the Storm is a collection of scenarios, backgrounds, hints for players and gamemasters and an original story based on the world of Dragon Storm.

This adventure book includes a tri-fold gamemaster's screen, maps and a complete card list for the Dragon Storm collectible role-playing card game.

rpgitemversion: Passcards 20 Pack With Keeper's Keep edition (Full Color)
67563.name: Passcards
67563.description:
From Publisher's Website:

PassCards® present the key to communication between individual players and the GM in a Conflict® game. During the setup time for a match, your PassCard® provides you the space you need to provide your GM with basic facts about your character, such as your saves, armor class, and so on. This information helps your GM when he needs to make decisions about certain actions, such as if one of your enemies attempts to cast dominate person on you without your knowledge.

67564.name: Kanchaka Valley
67564.description:
Excerpt from the back of the book:

This adventure book includes a description of the Zachtos valley, the history of the valley, information on the major cast members in the valley and the knowledge of the races that inhabit the vally.

The back cover also contains a set of 'test cards' intended to be cut out and used in play.

67565.name: Stella Incognita
67565.description:
User Summary:

Stella Incognita, a Stella Inquisitorus sourcebook, is focused on space travel. It contains a chapter on astronomy, rules and tips for creating worlds, information on the Independant Federations (solar systems outside the Stella Vaticanum) with a detailed example, a chapter about space exploration and the "Stella Incognita" (planets forgotten by the Stella Vaticanum and the Dunkle Reik) and a scenario for angels or demons ("Y'a pas de feu sans fumée").

67566.name: Dementia Profundis
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
67566.description:
User Summary:

Dementia Profundis is a mix of scenarios and gamemaster aids with a common theme, madness.

The books contains chapters about dragons (their philosophy, their powers and their genocide by the forces of Good), roleplaying madness, the parallel universes known as the "Marches Intermédiaires", and five scenarios, "Mademoiselle, auriez vous du feu? ou Un Dragon, c'est vachement porteur !" for angels or demons, Tout chez moi l'habite! ou Un cadavre de trop" also for both factions, "Christophe lâche sa tête", "Verte campagne électorale" and "Jeux de Masques... à gaz", three small scenarios that need to be fleshed out by the gamemaster.

67567.name: Haskalad Empire
67567.description:
Excerpt from the back of the book:

Visit the perilous Haskalad Empire, home of the blood thirsty, necro-worshipping, slave slaughtering Warp Evles, and those are the good points.

Shape shifters beware! Black Bane, emperor of the Haskald, means to conquer Kanchaka Valley. To thwart him, characters need to infiltrate his chaotic, dangerous kingdom. Valarians must learn the ways of the warp elves - and live to tell about it.

The back of the book contains a set of test cards to cut out and use.

67568.name: Vengeance!
67568.description:
User Summary:

Vengeance! is the last Bloodlust sourcebook. It can be used without the other sourcebooks, since it adds a new continent to the game universe, with a much different setting.

The book describes in great details the continent of Vaeriel and its civilization, technologically advanced humans who use magic to power machines. It contains a lot of revelations about the past of the planet and the origins of the God Weapons, and twenty scenario ideas to be fleshed out by the gamemaster.

67569.description:
The premiere issue of the ASL Journal was released in 1999.

(This description of the magazine comes from the publisher.)

The Table of Contents for ASL Journal #1 looks like this:


Hello From MMP


Where We're at and Where We're Going

Smoke Gets In Your Eyes




All You Wanted to Know About SMOKE

What To Do If You Have a Tin Can




Bad Tanks Aren't All That Bad

RB CG IV - Bled White




A New CG for the Greatest HASL Module Ever

Series Replay - Scouts Out




Scenario A109 - Scout's Out

Chapter S - Historical Solitaire ASL




RB HASL SASL

Personal Tens




My Favorite Scenarios

Welcome to the Jungle




Tactical Tips for Playing the Japanese

Run Through the Jungle




Programmed Instruction for the PTO

Rules:
Includes rule pages S23-S25 (with 99 superscript) for solitaire ASL.

Scenarios:
J1 Urban Guerillas
J2 Battlin' Buckeyes
J3 A Sunday Stroll
J4 Wet Sawahs
J5 Bizory Loves Company
J6 St. Barthelemy Bash
J7 Slow and Steady
J8 Block Busting in Bokruisk
J9 A Stiff Fight
J10 Armored Fist
J11 In the Old Tradition
J12 Jungle Fighters
SASL Mission r1 Assault on the Assembly Hall
SASL Mission r2 Breakout!
SASL Mission r3 Hold the Factory
SASL Mission r4 Assault on Red Barricades
67569.name: ASL Journal #1

67570.name: Final Stand
67570.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Final Stand is a game where you play a group of martial artists fighting for their lives. It is meant to be light, action-packed, and fun. Final Stand isn't heavy on setting. It's about cool characters and kick-ass action.

User Summary:

Final Stand is a free, independently published RPG that models martial arts movies. Game play is divided into combat encounters and "fluff" scenes, which are any non-combat portion of the game. The game includes few mechanics for "fluff" scenes, but does include a diceless, purely karma-based skill system for resolving basic non-combat conflicts. Combat, however, is resolved using three dice pools (kicking, punching and throwing), successes from which are spent on various moves available to each character according to martial arts forms chosen at character generation.

Secrets of Five Fingers: The Great Dome of the Channels

No Quarter Magazine #10 introduces Grind, an alternate way to use your WARMACHINE miniatures in a knock-down, drag-out arena combat game. Learn the mysteries of the Druids and warbeast bonding in your HORDES game.

67576.name: Range War!
67576.description:
From the back cover:

Range War! simulates the Old West conflict between cattle ranchers and sheepherders, rivals for grassland and water. This module for BOOT HILL Wild West Game includes:

12 action provoking scenarios

6 pregenerated player characters.

Over 200 nonplayer characters.

A city map of Promise Cit, Oregon using the BOOT HILL Street Map repeatedly.

Detailed building, ranch, settlement and farm descriptions.

Plus...

Background material for starting your own BOOT HILL campaign.

67578.name: Isla Tetra
67578.description:
(now available as Isla Tetra 2 - please check BGG page)

The first game from Will Sargent's Solway Games uses a colourful new puzzle system to create essential inventory items which can be used to explore the mysterious island, ISLA TETRA.

The same colourful grids are built to earn Exploration, Health and Fishing actions, making for a puzzling castaway adventure of the like never seen before.

You might think you can get by simply walking the sun-kissed sands, soaking up the sun, but leave your island escape plan too late and you'll find events back home have taken a turn for the worse: As the months tick by, the search for your crashed plane is eventually called off, your job is readvertised, and your car has been sold to keep up with the bills. After two years of waiting, your family holds a memorial service and your partner is now returning to a social life as a single person. You might be a great survivor, but at what cost?

Each turn players can beachcomb for useful items such as rope, old bits of wire and driftwood. You might even find a pilot's hat or laminated crash instructions washed up from the azure, salty brine. These pieces of flotsam and jetsam are shown on 52 professionally printed cards and represented by brightly coloured, chunky 3D shapes which can be linked neatly together on your individual player mat to build items essential for survival.

Players must strike a balance between plundering the island’s resources for points while ensuring they’re not last off the island. Finish too low down on the time-track and you'll accrue penalty points which could rob you of victory.

It's all about strategy, and fun puzzle solving. Some of your inventory items can only be built using a single colour, while others allow two or all three. Also, some grids are larger than others, taking longer to build, some are small and awkward to fit all the available shapes into.

Upgrades can give you more playing power, such as extra card swaps and extra jokers; longer explore moves; greater fish catches. Which to go for first? It's up to you to try the many different combinations.

To start, you are only allowed to build two items at a time so think carefully... whittle away by the fire at base camp, or set out deep into the island in search of vines and timber to help strengthen your small raft, ready for the final ordeal across raging seas...

source: from publisher: Solway Games

67580.name: The Drift
rpgissuearticle: That Bright Spot in the Sky
67580.description:
From the back cover:

An adventure for ALBEDO The Role-playing Game, Second Edition.

Many years ago a bitter battle was fought. Now the debris from that battle and bits of wreckage, floats in space, abandoned and alone. The player characters are wrecked near The Drift. They must improvise repairs to their wrecked ship from other ruined ships as their air and food grow dangerously low. Hungry, with interpersonal problems complicating their efforts, and air leaking from their ship, will they succeed in time to survive? Is The Drift is even more dangerous than it seems?

67581.name: Zho-Chaka
67581.description:
From the back cover:

An introductory adventure for ALBEDO The Role-Playing Game, Second Edition.

When Zho-Chaka's once benevolent government becomes oppressive, the people voted in the the youthful and energetic Zho-Chakan Progressive Party. Now the ZPP is the oppressor, but the change this time will not be as peaceful.

The player's characters are on the planet of Zho-Chaka in the middle of a civil war. Can they preserve the government and the planet's ties to the Confederation?

67582.name: Letter-Word-Picture
67582.description:
Letter-Word-Picture is a fun and competitive game for boys, girls and the whole family. In this game you learn many things! It is a means for developing language skills. The child learns new words with the help of the pictures. By matching pictures to words, the child develops verbal expression, enriches his/her vocabulary and concepts, differentiates between words and becomes familiar with the letters of the alphabet. By placing letters in the correct order to match pictures, the child learns to spell words correctly.
Aims: 1. To learn the letters of the alphabet. 2. To put letters together to make words. 3. To match words to pictures.
From the back of the box.
